availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lincoln County, Kentucky, merchant and trustee. Kentucky native. Son of Robert Stuart and Susan Stuart. Married to Mary Alexander Stuart in Woodford County, Kentucky, on March 1, 1858. Father of Alice T. Stuart, Rebecca L. Stuart, Beauregard Stuart, Annie Lee Stuart, and Lula V. Stuart. Resident in Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Merchant in Lincoln County, Kentucky, in 1860. Trustee of the town of Crab Orchard in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Southern District, p. 175A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, Crab Orchard, p. 54.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, Crab Orchard, p. 22A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Woodford County Marriages, Film #000252320.
"William Stuart (1833-1904)," Find A Grave, Memorial #127103515, accessed June 29, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/127103515.
KYR-0001-017-0112.
